title: WeWork reveals £76m loss at UK subsidiary
text:
Losses at WeWork’s main UK subsidiary ballooned last year as it pursued heavy growth, even as its biggest properties in London turned a profit.

Accounts for WeWork International, the office space start-up’s UK services company, revealed a £75.9m loss in 2018.

WeWork, which last week abandoned plans for a US flotation amid a string of controversies and financial questions, including the departure of its chief executive Adam Neumann, said the filings did not fully reflect the health of its UK operation and that it saw “solid financial performance” in the UK.

WeWork International does not register rental income from the company’s properties, but employs 440 WeWork staff in the UK and earns a “management...
description: Losses at WeWork’s main UK subsidiary ballooned last year as it pursued heavy growth, even as its biggest properties in London turned a profit.
